Contradict fact: The claim that "Jamaica has not recorded any case of the coronavirus" contradicts the fact that Jamaica has reported more than 35,300 COVID-19 cases and over 530 deaths.
Understate: The claim understates the actual number of COVID-19 cases and deaths in Jamaica by falsely stating that there have been no recorded cases.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or reliable sources to back up the assertion that Jamaica has no COVID-19 cases.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the absence of reported COVID-19 cases in Jamaica is due to the use of cannabis, without any scientific evidence or support.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the absence of reported COVID-19 cases in Jamaica, such as underreporting or limited testing capacity, which the claim fails to acknowledge.
